page.title: 12HEDGEROWS PART1
page.content: Grassy verges along country lanes, backed by fields, at first sight seem to be grasses of varying shades of green.Closer observation reveals many wild flowers. Surveyed in June,little vivid colour apart from {poppies} and{ {gorse.}We have listed the most common wild flowers.{Hogweed,}gathered to feed hogs.Young shoots can be eaten. Spikes of clustered white flowers which bloom June-August.{Rosebay {Willow Herb,}fast spreading.White fluffy seeds a common sight.Crimson flowers spiked up the stem,long thin leaves.Flowers June-September.{ {Dandelion,}leaves delicious when cooked or eaten in salad.Roots may be dried,roasted and ground to make coffee.Large petaled flower,long clear stem.Flowers March-September.{Red {Campion,}often crossed with white to give pink flowers. (Continued)
